result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas James Beck

defendant.name: Beck, Thomas James
defendant.address: 2026 Wallace Lake Rd, West Bend, WI 53090

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas James Beck appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def consents to video appearance. Modification of bond conditions. Argument on bond conditions. Court finds that Def has retained Attorney Nelson. Statements by Officer Vargo. Court takes judicial notice of 22CM844 and bond conditions. Attorney David Nelson appears by phone at 3:54PM. Argument on bond conditions. Court orders bond conditions to be modified to no contact with A.M.D, A.M.D's residence and their place of employment except incidental contact.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 195053,
Payable Number: 171694,
Receipt Number: 22R 020981,
Amount: $20.00
No contact with AMD or AMD's residence or place of employment

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas James Beck in court in custody via video.  Defendant consents to video appearance.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.  State requests $1,000 cash bond.  Court sets $1,000 cash bond.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
